de.polygonal.ds.pooling.ObjectPool<T>

type
class
implements
de.polygonal.ds.Hashable

A fixed sized, arrayed object pool.

Constructor

new(x : Int)

Creates an ObjectPool object capable of managing x pre-allocated objects.
Use allocate() to fill the pool.

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

Instance Methods

allocate(?C : Class<T>, ?fabricate : Void -> T, ?factory : de.polygonal.ds.Factory<T>) : Void

parameters
C allocates objects by instantiating the class C.
fabricate allocates objects by calling fabricate().
factory allocates objects by using a Factory object (calling factory.create()).
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError invalid arguments.
Allocates the pool.

countUnusedObjects() : Int

The total number of available objects.

countUsedObjects() : Int

The total number of objects in use.

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all objects for GC'ing used resources.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional).

inline get(id : Int) : T

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError invalid id or object linked to id is not used.
Returns the object that is mapped to id.
Call next() to request an id first.

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if all objects are in use.

iterator() : de.polygonal.ds.Itr<T>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new ObjectPoolIterator object to iterate over all pooled objects, regardless if an object is used or not.

inline next() : Int

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError pool exhausted (debug only).
Returns the id to the next free object.
After an id has been obtained, the corresponding object can be retrieved using get(id).

inline put(id : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertionError pool is full or object linked to id is not used (debug only).
Puts the object mapped to id back into the pool.

inline size() : Int

The total number of pre-allocated objects in the pool.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Prints out all object if compiled with the -debug directive.
